CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 17, 1945, pg. 1, reads: "Counsel for Defense - Some of the Nation's most brilliant lawyers acted as counsel for the defense of Ralph Johnson in extradition case which closed this week. After the hearing Friday, a conference was held in the office of Homer S. Brown.  Left to right: Attorneys Brown, Vincent Smith, Thurgood Marshall, NAACP legal chief, and Marquis Smith.  George Sweeney, who posted bail for Johnson, is at the extreme right. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Counsel for the defense of Ralph Johnson, from left: Homer S. Brown, Vincent Smith shaking hands with Thurgood Marshall, Marquis Smith, and George Sweeney, posed in Brown's office
